com.github.crashdemons.playerheads

Class SkullManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.crashdemons.playerheads.SkullManager

  • public final class SkullManager
extends Object
    Defines an abstract class of methods for creating, updating, and applying information to heads managed by the plugin.
    Author:
    crash, x7aSv

    • Method Detail

      • MobSkull

        public static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack MobSkull(TexturedSkullType type,
                                                      boolean useVanillaHeads)
        Creates a stack of heads for the specified Mob's SkullType. The quantity of heads will be defined by Config.defaultStackSize (usually 1)
        Parameters:
        type - The TexturedSkullType to create heads of.
        useVanillaHeads - Whether to permit vanilla head-items to be used in place of custom playerheads for supported mobs.
        Returns:
        The ItemStack of heads desired.
        See Also:
        Config.defaultStackSize

      • MobSkull

        public static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack MobSkull(TexturedSkullType type,
                                                      int quantity,
                                                      boolean useVanillaHeads)
        Creates a stack of heads for the specified Mob's SkullType
        Parameters:
        type - The TexturedSkullType to create heads of.
        quantity - the number of heads to create in the stack
        useVanillaHeads - Whether to permit vanilla head-items to be used in place of custom playerheads for supported mobs.
        Returns:
        The ItemStack of heads desired.

      • PlayerSkull

        public static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack PlayerSkull(String owner)
        Creates a stack of playerheads for the given username. The username given is translated to an OfflinePlayer by bukkit at the time of creation. Note: if the owner name is null or can't be translated to a player internally, a generic playerhead will be created with the name "Unknown". The quantity of heads will be defined by Config.defaultStackSize (usually 1)
        Parameters:
        owner - The username to create a head for.
        Returns:
        The ItemStack of heads desired.
        See Also:
        Config.defaultStackSize

      • PlayerSkull

        public static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack PlayerSkull(String owner,
                                                         int quantity)
        Creates a stack of playerheads for the given username. The username given is translated to an OfflinePlayer by bukkit at the time of creation. NOTE: null or empty usernames will be rejected with an IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        owner - The username to create a head for.
        quantity - The number of heads to create in the stack.
        Returns:
        The ItemStack of heads desired.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - passed a null or empty username.

      • spawnSkull

        public static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack spawnSkull(String spawnString,
                                                        boolean usevanillaheads)
        Spawns a skull itemstack using an input spawn string or username. The quantity of heads will be defined by Config.defaultStackSize (usually 1)
        Parameters:
        spawnString - the spawn string indicating the type of skull or username indicating the owner of the skull.
        usevanillaheads - Whether to permit vanilla head-items to be used in place of custom playerheads for supported mobs. (if the spawn string is recognized)
        Returns:
        The skull itemstack desired. If the spawn string is recognized, this will be the corresponding entity's head, otherwise it will be a playerhead for the name supplied.

      • spawnSkull

        public static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack spawnSkull(String spawnString,
                                                        int quantity,
                                                        boolean usevanillaheads)
        Spawns a skull itemstack using an input spawn string or username.
        Parameters:
        spawnString - the spawn string indicating the type of skull or username indicating the owner of the skull.
        quantity - the number of items to spawn in this stack.
        usevanillaheads - Whether to permit vanilla head-items to be used in place of custom playerheads for supported mobs. (if the spawn string is recognized)
        Returns:
        The skull itemstack desired. If the spawn string is recognized, this will be the corresponding entity's head, otherwise it will be a playerhead for the name supplied.

      • updatePlayerSkullState

        public static void updatePlayerSkullState(org.bukkit.block.BlockState skullState)
        Updates the blockstate of a head. Originally this method also updated legacy username-based skulls to the correct owner - currently it only updates the blockstate. Since these skulls are upgraded and textured-skulls have embedded textures, this method may not be necessary and may be removed in the future.
        Parameters:
        skullState - the blockstate to update.
